intro: Eriocephalus eenii, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a shrub-like appearance with aromatic leaves. It produces small, cylindrical fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Eriocephalus eenii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in sandy soils.
